poem:
Title: "A Ballet of Excess"

In this gyre of opulence, jets pin-drop silent,
hovercrafts hum lullabies to tycoon children,
and supercars, like giant skateboards, curve through air alive.
In this ballet of excess, a call for higher taxes takes flight,
Unseen amidst the gleaming flotilla of privilege.
Each wing-beat an argument, echoing in hangar's hollow heart,
Against a backdrop of gold, the tributes of the affluent lay bare.
